text:
Pregnant Kate Middleton is pretty in pink as she wears favourite Mulberry coat for Coventry visit

The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge are spending the day there to celebrate Coventry's UK City of Culture 2021 honour

View 6 Images Kate arrived in Coventry in a wardrobe favourite (Image: Rex/Getty)

Pregnant Kate Middleton and Prince William arrived to screams from the crowds who'd gathered to meet them in Coventry on Tuesday morning.

‌



The royal couple are there to celebrate Coventry's UK City of Culture 2021 honour and will also open Coventry University’s new £59m Science and Health Building.

‌



Kate, who is expecting her third baby in April, looked gorgeous in her cerise pink Mulberry coat - a wardrobe favourite she first wore in New York in 2014, when pregnant with Princess Charlotte. She also wore it again to visit the Stephen Lawrence Centre in 2015, just before she gave birth.

‌



View 6 Images Kate stood out in the bold coat (Image: REX/Shutterstock)

The double-breasted jacket is from the British brand's AW14 collection and originally cost £1,500. Naturally it sold out within days of the Duchess wearing it.

Could the bold colour suggest that another little Princess is on her way?

‌



View 6 Images Kate first wore her Mulberry coat in New York, in 2014 (Image: Rex)

Kate teamed her coat with a dress, black tights and her matching suede Tod's pumps.

She finished off her look with her Mulberry Bayswater black clutch bag and her Kiki McDonough pink morganite "Classic" cushion cut earrings.

‌



View 6 Images Kate teamed her look with pale pink earrings (Image: REX/Shutterstock)

The Duchess returned to royal duties last week following the Christmas break, where she visited Reach Academy Feltham to learn about their partnership with Place2Be and attended a conference hosted by the Anna Freud Centre - both are children's mental health and wellbeing charities.

View 6 Images Kate wore a Hobbs coat to visit a school last week (Image: PA)

‌



Kate will also be out and about tomorrow in London to open the the Mittal Children's Medical Centre at Great Ormond Street Hospital and to visit Bond Primary School to see the work of the Wimbledon Junior Tennis Initiative.

Kensington Palace have also released further details about Kate and William's four day tour of Sweden and Norway at the end of the month, where the couple will spend time with the respective royal families of each country.

Get Kate's look for less
